pyrh_redesign.portfolio¶

The following class, Portoflio, is used to represent an existing Robinhod user’s portfolio. The portfolio comprises of the instrument the user owns along with securities and positions.

class portfolio.Portfolio[source]¶

An existing Robinhood User’s Portfolio.

Methods

__init__()

Creates a new Portfolio object.

__str__()

Prints contents of Portfolio

value(value_type)

Returns portfolio equity or market value.

contains_instrument(instrument[, quantity])

Determines of current portfolio contains the given instrument.

excess_margin()

Returns the excess margin portfolio

extended_hours_value(value_type)

Returns portfolio extended_hours equity or market value.

equity_previous_close([adjusted])

Returns portfolio equity_previous_close

last_core_value(value_type)

Returns portfolio last core value

dividends()

The dividends for a portfolio.

positions([previously_held])

The positions for a user’s portfolio.

Creates a new Portfolio object.

__str__() → str[source]¶

Prints contents of Portfolio

value(value_type: portfolio.Portfolio.ValueType) → decimal.Decimal[source]¶

Returns portfolio equity or market value.

Args:

value_type: the value type {EQUITY or MARKET_VALUE}

Returns:

Float representing the value.

contains_instrument(instrument: instrument.Instrument, quantity: float = 0.0)[source]¶

Determines of current portfolio contains the given instrument.

excess_margin() → decimal.Decimal[source]¶

Returns the excess margin portfolio

extended_hours_value(value_type: portfolio.Portfolio.ValueType) → decimal.Decimal[source]¶

Returns portfolio extended_hours equity or market value.

Args:

value_type: the value type {EQUITY or MARKET_VALUE}

equity_previous_close(adjusted: bool = False) → decimal.Decimal[source]¶

Returns portfolio equity_previous_close

Args:

adjusted: flag to determine standard or adjusted previous_close

last_core_value(value_type: portfolio.Portfolio.ValueType) → decimal.Decimal[source]¶

Returns portfolio last core value

Args:

value_type: the value type {EQUITY or MARKET_VALUE}

dividends() → list[source]¶

The dividends for a portfolio.

Returns:

List of dividends, where each dividend represented by single dict

example dividend:

{

id: ID_NUMBER_AS_STR, url: URL_AS_STR, account: ACCOUNT_URL_AS_STR, instrument: INSTRUMENT_URL_AS_STR, amount: 0.36, rate: 0.1200000000, position: 3.00000000, withholding: 0.00, record_date: 2020-03-05, payable_date: 2020-03-16, paid_at: 2020-03-17T02:14:50Z, state: paid, nra_withholding: None, drip_enabled: False

}

positions(previously_held: bool = False) → list[source]¶

The positions for a user’s portfolio.

Args:

previously_held: bool. include positions where the user has 0 quantity

Returns:

dict representation of a position

example position:

{

url: https://api.robinhood.com/positions/ACCOUNT_NUMBER/ID_NUMBER/, instrument: https://api.robinhood.com/instruments/ID_NUMBER/, account: https://api.robinhood.com/accounts/ACCOUNT_NUMBER/, account_number: ACCOUNT_NUMBER, average_buy_price: PRICE_STR_FLT, pending_average_buy_price: PRICE_STR_FLT, quantity: QUANTITY_STR_FLT, intraday_average_buy_price: 0.0000, intraday_quantity: 0.00000000, shares_held_for_buys: 0.00000000, shares_held_for_sells: 2.00000000, shares_held_for_stock_grants: 0.00000000, shares_held_for_options_collateral: 0.00000000, shares_held_for_options_events: 0.00000000, shares_pending_from_options_events: 0.00000000, updated_at: 2020-05-02T20:11:41.491656Z, created_at: 2019-07-31T23:57:07.494746Z, symbol: GOOG

}
